PageTitle: display bgp ipv6 routing-table peer statistics
FuncDef: The display bgp ipv6 routing-table peer statistics command displays the routing statistics of the specified BGP4+ peer. The display bgp ipv6 routing-table peer statistics command displays the routing statistics of the specified BGP4+ peer. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display bgp ipv6 routing-table peer { <remoteIpv4Addr> | <remoteIpv6Addr> } { advertised-routes | received-routes | received-routesactive } statistics

ParaDef.Info:
Specify an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Routes advertised to the remote peer.
-

Indicates the routes from the peer.
-

Displays the active routes received from the specified peer.
-

Specifies the IPv6 address of a peer.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display bgp ipv6 routing-table peer 2001:DB8:9:3::1 received-routes statistics
